pullRequest.title: FISH-796 Fix clustered singleton bugs and added test
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
As I upgraded the code to Hazelcast 4, one of my tests was clustered singleton.
In the process of doing this, I found a few bugs, and re-added test
Important Info
Relates to #5014 and #5013
Testing
New tests
added back tests in Payara root to test clustered singleton
Testing Performed
automated and manual tests, as well as suite
Testing Environment
JDK 8, Mac
Notes for Reviewers
The PR seems big, but it's mostly new test files added

beforeCommit.message: setting usage count to zero instead of destroying it - from the original branch

afterCommit.message: fixed clustered singleton bugs appeared during migration to Hazelcast 4.0
fixed clustered singleton bugs appeared during migration to Hazelcast 4

nodes.bodyText: I'm not quite sure why I changed this, needs a bit further investigating

beforeCommit.message: refactored (pre)destory() singleton contituents into a single method that deals with all of them

afterCommit.message: fixed bugs in clustered singleton, added arquillian tests

commit.message: fixed bugs in clustered singleton, added arquillian tests

afterCommit.message: fixed bugs in clustered singleton, added arquillian tests

commit.message: clustered singleton-related CP objects can't be destroyed

nodes.bodyText: This looks like a leaked file from NetBeans, probably needs deleting
I'd like the packages changing to fish.payara, inkeeping with the other tests

nodes.bodyText:
Oh god, didn't we do a tonne of work a while ago to remove Lombok?
I'm not concerned with what our answer is, but I'd like it resolved before we continue this loop of adding and removing lombok

nodes.bodyText: Looks like there are some copyright headers that need fixing, then this is good to go IMO
